summary: This is an internal email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a news article about an attorney for an Epstein guard having a shouting match with a judge over vacation plans. The exchange reveals the prosecutors' perspective that the guard's situation is less sympathetic because travel was not yet booked.

persons.name: Foy
persons.context: Subject of news articles discussed in the email; his client is a guard involved in the Epstein case and he had a confrontation with a judge over vacation plans.

events.title: Attorney-Judge Shouting Match Over Vacation
events.description: An attorney for an Epstein guard had a shouting match with a judge over vacation plans, as reported in news articles.

keyFacts: Internal DOJ email discusses a news story about an Epstein guard's attorney.
The attorney, Foy, had a confrontation with a judge regarding vacation plans for his client (a guard).
The prosecutors in the exchange express that the guard's situation is 'WAY less sympathetic' because travel was not yet booked, indicating their assessment of the guard's claims.
